Name: Göbeklitepe Ancient Board Game
Description:
Göbeklitepe, which has a sacred consciousness, bears the traces of productivity culture. In addition, it is the oldest known cult building group with its beliefs about death and rebirth, the belief that there is life after death, and compositions applied on stones.

My work is an ancient board game consisting of t-columns, animal drawings, figures and the mythical meanings of symbols, which play an important role in the building art of this sacred area.

Reaching the Central Zone of the game with the T-Column, obtaining the Central T Arm and being the first to reach the U-Stone Gate again.

The first player to enter the buildings from the Building Entrances and obtain the Central T-Column in the Center Area and return to the U-Stone Gate wins. Or, the first player to return to the U-Stone Gate by making mandatory entry to all structures, obtaining the Central T-Pillar located in the Center Area, wins.

Figures, T-Pillars and Center T-Pillars were hand modeled in polymer clay as the closest miniature replica.

Name: 铁底湾的回响 (Iron Bottom Sound IV)
Description: Iron Bottom Sound IV is a tactical simulation of night naval surface combat in WW2.

Name: Gordon Greenfee Golfgame
Description:
Players roll their piece (tee) across a golf course and complete the 18 holes. For this, 3 different dice are used (Normal: values 1, 2, 3; Putting: Values 1 and 2; Handicap: Values 1, 2, 3 and 3 events). In addition, there are event fields on which event cards must be drawn. The player who has needed the fewest strokes after completing all holes wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Lese-Domino
Description:
4 different reading dominoes in different difficulty levels to learn to read.


     20 cards where you have to pay attention to certain initial letters.
     20 cards with riddles.
     20 cards with search words.
     20 cards with additional sentences.


Here not only the mechanical reading is trained, but above all the sense-comprehending reading.
Only those who read correctly will find the right card!

The cards of a game are shuffled and distributed to the players. Now the cards have to be placed in such a way that the words or texts match the pictures of the previous card or vice versa... The first to lay down his domino cards wins the game.

Name: Négociateur Prise d'Otages: Edition Collector Intégrale
Description:
The complete set of the famous solitaire game Hostage Negotiator, in a complete edition including the base game and all its expansions.

Contents of the box:


     The base game Hostage Negotiator in its original box 
     Crime Wave Expansion
     The first 8 expansions
     A unique expansion set! (also available in the classic Crime Wave box).

Name: Deutschland Rummy
Description:
The popular tile-laying game RUMMY, now in a German version! As in the famous classic, each player tries to get rid of his tiles as quickly as possible, but in this version, each tile shows a connection between two cities from the German rail network.
From Rostock to Berlin it is 227 km and then on to Potsdam, or rather to Wolfsburg? The player whose turn it is tries to use his tiles to lay routes and to rebuild already played routes in order to get rid of tiles from his own supply.
This creates city connections throughout the entire rail network. Only the first player to get rid of his tiles can win the game!

—user summary

Name: Lustige Quatschrätsel
Description:
A trivia card game with humorous answers. The questions are read aloud. Whoever knows the answer gets the question card. Whoever has collected 5 question cards wins. The peculiarity of the game is that the answers require creative word creations. For example, the correct answer to the question "What swims in the sea and can calculate?" is "Octo-plus". As a support, the question cards are illustrated and shown to the guessers.

—user summary

Name: Baby Shark Party at the Reef Game
Description: Work together to get Baby, Mommy, and Daddy Shark to the party on Coral Reef. But hurry before the seaweed storm washes everything away. Roll the die and then press the button to determine how many spaces you get the move the Shark and which Shark you get to roll. But be careful, roll a seaweed and you are one step closer to ending the game.

Name: Marvel Champions: The Card Game – The Hood Scenario Pack
Description:
Ever since he witnessed a battle between Electro and Daredevil as a child, the life of a supervillain was enticing to Parker Robbins. Later, while stealing money to pay for his mother’s medical care, a chance encounter with a demon left Robbins with a pair of boots that let him walk on air and an equally-mystical red cloak. Now, as the Hood, Robbins and his budding criminal empire are swiftly becoming a formidable threat to the people of New York City.

This 78-card scenario pack introduces a new scenario to Marvel Champions showcasing the Hood and his notorious organization of supervillains. Also included are a whopping nine modular encounter sets that can be mixed in with any scenario—including the Hood’s—to add more customization options to your Marvel Champions experience. Are you prepared to take down a dangerous criminal empire?

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Marvel Champions – The Card Game

Name: Unmurphed: Mike Murphy – Nick Murphy
Description:
This is a fan made deck for Unmatched featuring The Brothers Murph as a playable Hero that will be fully compatible with all Unmatched sets. This is not a Restoration Games or Mondo Games product but was given the blessing of Restoration Games and has been given guidance on design by their team and will be produced through Game Crafter during The Brothers Murph's Kickstarter Campaign

—description from the designer

Name: Die Reise durch den Schwarzwald
Description: The players start at space 1 (Karlsruhe). The first to reach space 62 (Stuttgart) wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Name: Pinocchio
Description:
The board features an outline of six characters from the story of Pinocchio (pre-Disney).  Players spin the spinner and try to collect the 6 pieces they need to cover the character outline on the boards. The spinner has a combination of colors and character icons. If the arrow points to a character icon, you can add a piece to your character's outline on the board. If the arrow lands on a color, then you receive a joker tile of that color. If that color is spun again on a future turn, the person holding that color joker tile gets to add a piece to their character's outline on the board. The joker tile is returned to the pool.

The first person to complete their character, wins.

Name: Road Trippin
Description:
This is a Vanity License Plate Word Game for Competitive People. Create and Solve Custom Vanity Plates in a Race Across Country

Players will draw a card containing a phrase and have to convert that phrase into a license plate. Then, depending on the game mode (Team Vs, Cooperative, or FFA) other players will guess what the phrase says. A point is scored for guessing a plate correctly as well as additional points for using numbers and having unused blank spaces at the end of the plate. Points are scored on a race track with cars representing the players/teams. First car to complete their road trip wins!

Name: King of Tokyo: Dark Edition – Promo Cards for 2nd Edition
Description:
A set of three promo cards for the Second Edition of King of Tokyo packaged in the Dark Edition.  These cards have 2nd edition backs.

They only exist in French.

Here are the translations of the powers:

ADN Instable : When you run away from Tokyo, you can exchange this card with a card that belongs to the monster who hurt you.

Bond Fantastique : At your turn, you can spend 1 flash to cancel the loss of 1 heart (you can use it only once/round).

Bouclier réfléchissant : Monsters who hurt you lose 1 heart.

Name: Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels – Shield Knight
Description: A unique hero character for Shovel Knight: Dungeon Duels that plays more defensively, able to spend coins on their turn to reflect damage back at attacking enemies!

Name: Bee Good
Description:
Everyone knows them, the bees that fly from flower to flower in summer. They have very important duties. Through pollination, they make a significant contribution to the preservation of biodiversity. But bees are at risk. The death of bees could have far-reaching consequences for all of us. In the game you will learn about the importance of bees for our ecosystem and receive specific tips and information on how we can contribute to the preservation of bees.

Tiles are shuffled, distributed on the honeycombs on the board and turned over one by one. Each player tries to get to the beehive via a path made of green tiles and avoiding the red tiles that can hurt or kill them.  Players roll a die to move around the tiles of the board to find flowers and nectar to strengthen and survive on their long journey back to the beehive in the center of the board.

Bee Good is a co-op board game. Only together can the team ensure that all bees find a way to their beehive. If a player's bee has already arrived in the beehive, he can continue playing and throw the dice for the other players and win jokers. The players win if all bees make it back to the hive.

Name: Zombies!!!: WTH...20 Years? Promo Card
Description:
This card says:

Power's out: Until the end of your next turn, any items in buildings may not be picked up(including weapon cards). You must fight zombies as normal.

Promo sent to backers of the 20th Anniversary edition of Zombies!!!

Name: Rossio: D.Maria II Promo Card
Description:
Rules for this promo card.

SETUP: Choose which side of the promo card to use during the game: "+1" for a more forgiving game or "-1" side for a more cutthroat game.
Place the promo card next to the game board and randomly assign a tile to it.

GAMEPLAY: During your turn, when you score the patterns on your helper cards, patterns of the same colour as the tile on the promo card will score +1 point (if using the +1 side of the promo card) or -1 point (if using the -1 side of the promo card).
Also, when building tiles on the square, players may pay 1 coin to swap any tile of their player board with the tile on the promo card.

Available as part of Pack C from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Der verflixte Turm
Description:
Players receive 20 tiles each in four different sizes and point values. Together they build a tower out of these until it collapses. Whoever causes the collapse receives no points, the other player, the point values from his built tiles. After several rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Formino
Description:
With 4 of their own pieces each, the 2 opponents try to recreate the winning constellations of their card "hand" - which they have on their tray (integrated in the game board) - on the 3x3 game board, whereby only one piece may be moved per turn.

—user summary

Name: Sesamstraat Kids Bingo
Description:
The boards show pictures from Sesame Street or the five letters of the word BINGO in a 5 x 5 grid. Two dice are rolled to determine the field. The first person to cover five pictures horizontally, vertically or diagonally is the winner.

—user summary

Name: Arkanum: Die Schatzinsel
Description:
Experience exciting puzzles - solve the puzzles to uncover the secret of Treasure Island.
Escape room game with web app for sounds and stories.
Board game for 1-6 adults from 14 years, 90-120 minutes playing time.
Unique 3D game board - scissors, pen, internet access and light source (cell phone or flashlight) required to play.
No destruction of material necessary! However, once you have solved the game, you know the solution.

Name: The Code Agency Sonderermittlung Krimispiel Fall 1: Flammen im Theater
Description:
For the whole family - interactive and cooperative Murder Mystery board game for adults and children from 13 years.
Solve the riddle - Follow the exciting story of the burned out Figaro Theater in this riddle game.
Realistic Material - Work your way through 25+ realistic documents and examine real finds from the burned theater.
Fun for everyone - the criminal case can be solved alone, in pairs or in a team with up to 6 players.
Gift idea - The crime game is also ideal as a gift for Escape Room fans and friends of exciting board games.

Name: Exit-Game Wochenkalender 2022: Der Schnitter
Description:
53 new puzzles - 53 possible victims of the reaper!

A must for all fans of escape games and challenging puzzles
There is a new task waiting for you every week
Puzzles alone, with friends or family
 Dysturbia's last line-up is in mortal danger: a former killer of the Syndicate crime organization, who calls himself "The Reaper", is running amok. He wants to eliminate all enemies of the cartel on his own within a year. Police, public prosecutor's office, journalism - anyone who still stands up for law and truth in Dysturbia will be targeted by the assassin!

Your detective agency Dyscover is also on the hit list. After all, the reaper grants his targets a week's hangover: every Monday he hides a riddle somewhere in town. If you find it and solve it by Sunday evening, he will spare his next victim. Otherwise it has to die. Take your chance!

Name: Pocket-Escape: Schlagabtausch
Description:
Carl Mac Sweeney's former boxing coach Eddie is in trouble: 
He owes the syndicate money. A lot of money. In desperation, he turns to Carl and asks him a favor - because Eddie knows where to get something...

28 pages full of puzzles, action and difficult decisions are waiting for you. Pocket Escape: The exchange of blows fits in every pocket - the ideal case for at home or in your luggage!

Name: Pocket-Escape: Schatten der Vergangenheit
Description:
Alice discovers her likeness on a wanted poster - an aunt is looking for her! Does this aunt really exist? Or is the profile just a trap? Alice has to use all her courage and ingenuity to face her past...

28 pages full of puzzles, action and difficult decisions.

Name: The Aquabats!: Super Showdown!
Description:
In The Aquabats! Super Showdown! card game, two to four players are villains competing to capture all five members of The Aquabats, the world's greatest superhero rock band.

The game consists of three types of cards: Monster cards, Action cards, and Aquabats cards. Monster cards have colors and power levels. Each turn, a player plays a Monster card and draws a new  Monster card. If the card played is of the same color and a higher power level than the card previously played, that player may draw both a Monster card and an Action card. At the start of a player's turn, a Battle card or Epic Battle card may be played, challenging one player or all players respectively to a showdown. Each player in the battle must play a Monster card, and the winner may take an Aquabat card from the table or, if none remain, steal one from the defeated player.

Shrink Ray cards enable a challenged player to diminish the power of an aggressor; X-Ray cards allow one to peak at another player's hand; Antibats cards foil the winner of a battle from taking a loser's Aquabat card; and Steal cards can be used to acquire another player's Aquabat card without a battle.

Play continues until one player acquires all five Aquabat cards or until War is mutually declared, in which case the winner of a single round Epic Battle is declared the game's victor.

Name: Companion Quest
Description:
This game presents 5 clues to the identity of a Companion.

With over 500 jewels covering the lives of over 100 Companions, encapsulated in a thrilling clues game, Companion Quest is one of a kind. As a dual game, designed to be played between two people or teams, clues are read out revealing the identity of a Companion.

The faster you guess, the more points you gain. 
The set also contains a bonus Highlights and Villains set which completes the package beautifully.

—description from the publisher

Name: Companion Clues
Description:
This game poses a question and gives kids four possible answers to choose from.

This children's game uses logical deduction and multiple choice questions to learn about the Companions.

It's a fantastic learning tool to get to know about the Sahaba in a thought-provoking way.

Companion Clues covers 60 Sahaba and is also designed to be played as a duel game between two or more people or teams.

Score more points by answering the harder questions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barely Balanced: The Stunt Stacking Game – Troublemakers Expansion
Description:
The stage is your self!  You and up to 3 friends rush to preform Tricks to see who can score the most points.

The player who scores the most points each round wins the round!

The game ends once any player has won 3 rounds but the player with the most points wins the game!

—description from the back of the box

Name: UNO Triple Play
Description:
UNO Triple Play features the familiar UNO gameplay, with players trying to rid themselves of cards first, but this game comes with a special electronic unit that holds three discard piles and features lights and sounds. On your turn, you can play onto a discard pile only if it's lit up — and if any pile gets too many cards in it, it may overload, with the LED display indicating how many cards must be drawn!

Lights and arcade sounds on the machine create maximum anticipation and excitement, and the "timer mode" makes the game move even faster. As always, when players have only one card left, they must yell "UNO!"

Name: Crossing Fates
Description:
In Crossing Fates 7 different nations fight for supremacy. But temporary alliances give players special powers with which they can score more points, or steal from their opponents.
Cleverly play and match cards for Fate Points and combine totems for various effects. A deceptively simple game with lots of strategy. Will you win the Battle of Fates?

Crossing Fates is a competitive card game for 2 to 4 players.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fizzog
Description:
Match tiles with half faces to create complete faces and score points for matching features. Sparse line drawn artwork and simple game play makes this game very suitable for small children

It is a kind of domino game consisting of box with 25 domino-like cards where you have to try and make a complete face in the right mood and colour.  If you can't match a tile, you pick another one to add to your stack.  The first player to play all their tiles, wins.

Name: Andor Junior: Die Fährtenleserin Fennah / Der Fährtenleser Fenn
Description:
As a tracker, you know your way around Andor. A raven is always at your side as a loyal companion. It supports you in your fight against other creatures and helps you finding things with its keen eyes.

Als Fährtenleser kennst Du Dich besonders gut in Andor aus. An Deiner Seite hast Du einen Raben als treuen Gefährten. Der Rabe unterstützt Dich im Kampf gegen Kreaturen und hilft Dir mit seinen scharfen Augen beim Suchen.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Vacu
Description:
Vacu is a Go-like territory game for two players: Black and White. It is played on the intersections (points) of an initially empty square board. Each player must have access to a sufficient number of stones of their own color.

				
				
					DefinitionsIn these rules, "adjacent" always means "orthogonally adjacent".

A group is a stone along with all other like-colored stones one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent stones of its color.

Similarly, a territory is an empty point along with all other empty points one could reach from it through a series of steps between adjacent empty cells. You own a territory if all stones adjacent to points in that territory are of your color.

A liberty of a group is an empty point adjacent to at least one stone in that group.

To flip a group is to replace all its stones with stones of the opposite color.

To suppress a group is to remove all its stones from the board.

Your score is the number of stones of your color on the board, plus the number of points in your territories, plus komi (see below) if you play White.

				
				
					PlayBlack plays first, then turns alternate. On your turn, pass or place a stone of your color on an empty point. If this stone is part of a group with liberties, suppress all enemy groups without liberties. Otherwise, suppress your group without liberties and flip all enemy groups that had no liberties before the suppression. In the latter case, at least one group must be flipped for the move to be legal.

The game ends when either both players pass in succession or a player flips or suppresses the last enemy group on the board. The player with the higher score in the final position wins. The button is used to avoid ties.

If, after a board play, the same board position appears for the third time with the same player to move, the game ends in a draw. A pass is not a board play.

				
				
					Komi and buttonKomi is the whole number of points which is added to White's score at the end of the game as a compensation for playing second. Before the game starts, the first player chooses the value of komi, and then the second player chooses sides. Alternatively, experienced players may agree on a standard value for all games.

The button is a special token which is placed next to the board at the start of the game. On your turn, if neither player has taken the button yet, you may not pass, but you may take the button instead of making a board play. At the end of the game, a half point is added to the score of the player who has taken the button. When checking for repetitions, two identical board positions are still considered different if the button had already been taken in one of them but not in the other.

				
				
					VariantsConvacu: The top and bottom edges of the board are colored black; the left and right edges are colored white. If you have no other moves available, you must pass. Passing is otherwise not allowed. If, at the end of a turn, there is a group touching the two opposite board edges of its color, the owner of that group wins.

Name: 18 Hiawatha
Description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, 18 Hiawatha is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1817 game system, this variant encourages active use of the shorting mechanism, includes new private companies, and comes with a few game-specific tiles. You’ll need a copy of 1817 to play this game.

Name: 18 Milwaukee
Description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, 18 Milwaukee is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1846 game system, this variant features beer delivery to enhance your routes, and the ability to create new cities where none previously existed - no early route is safe!  You’ll need a copy of 1846 to play this game.

Name: The Hiawathas
Description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, The Hiawathas is an 18xx game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven 1830 game system, this variant allows you to draw track instead of placing track tiles.  You’ll need a copy of 1830 to play this game.

Name: Irish Gauge: Hiawatha Gauge
Description: Published exclusively in the Autumn 2021 edition of TraXX Mainline magazine, Hiawatha Gauge is a cube rails game set along the routes of the historic Milwaukee Road Hiawatha trains. Featuring the proven Irish Gauge game system, this is a "magazine game" variant on a small map with only three companies.  You’ll need a copy of Irish Gauge to play this game.

Name: Миссионерские путешествия апостола Павла
Description:
In ÐœÐ¸ÑÑÐ¸Ð¾Ð½ÐµÑ€ÑÐºÐ¸Ðµ Ð¿ÑƒÑ‚ÐµÑˆÐµÑÑ‚Ð²Ð¸Ñ Ð°Ð¿Ð¾ÑÑ‚Ð¾Ð»Ð° ÐŸÐ°Ð²Ð»Ð°, ("Missionary travels of the Apostle Paul"), the players will embark on a fascinating adventure in the footsteps of the missionary journey of the apostle.

It will begin in Jerusalem, from where Saul went to Damascus to begin massacring the Christians of this city. And it will continue in the cities of Asia Minor and Europe. 
Many adventures await them: ferocious lions, robbers and even a shipwreck. 
The winner is the player who overcomes all obstacles and gets to Rome first.

During the game, they will be able to get acquainted with the letters of the Apostle Paul, addressed to different churches, which he founded during his missionary travels.

So, imagine that you are the apostle Paul, and off you go! You will face many difficulties, but fulfill your mission - to bring the good news of Jesus Christ to the peoples of the Balkan Peninsula and Asia Minor.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Get Past & GO!
Description:
Get Past & GO! is a competitive, family-friendly card game for 2-4 players. Race against your opponents to be the first player to reach the end of their path and overcome the mysterious 'Final Hazard'.

Through turn-based play, dash along your path of cards as quickly as possible - turning over each step as you go. Use Tool cards (like a torch or a tin of sardines) to get past a series of Hazards set by your opponents, or place Hazards on their paths to slow them down! Give yourself an advantage or frustrate other players with Action Cards or once-per-game Bonus Cards!

Get Past & GO! is a standalone game with 90 illustrated cards and rule variations for 2-player showdowns.

On you marks, get set, GO!

—description from the designer

Name: Gather Round! Alice in the Wonder Museum
Description:
"Gather the characters from Alice's story and start your own little funny tale!"

In Gather Round! Alice in the Wonder Museum, each player has a hand of cards featuring small and large portraits of seven characters from the books by Lewis Carrol. The game has a whimsical graphic design, utilizing the original illustrations by John Tenniel.

The goal is to have a hand of five cards where every small portrait matches a large portrait. Upon building a complete hand, the player scores a point for each small portrait in their hand. The first player to 20 points wins.

Each player keeps four cards in their hand. On your turn, you draw from the deck or the discards of other players. Trying to build a set of matching cards in hand is a puzzle, with each card having one large portrait and one to three small portraits. If your turn ends without creating a completed hand, discard one card face up in front of you. Be careful, because other players will be able to choose from your discards, but you cannot.

Name: Charges: Antiques et médiévales
Description:
Miniature wargame rules to simulate battles from Antiquity to the Middle Ages.

Using figures 15 to 28 mm.

It offers a budget system to build balanced battles that allows for competition games.

Name: Pugs Fart, Too!
Description: Expansion pack featuring Pugs. This stink-packed expansion pack includes 54 playing cards that can be used to expand your Farting Frenchies game to add 2-3- more players. It can also be played as a complete stand alone game for 2-3 players.

Name: Farting Frenchies: Celebrity Dogs Fart, Too!
Description: This stink-packed expansion pack includes 54 playing cards that can be used to expand your Farting Frenchies game to add 2-3 more players. It can also be played as a complete stand alone game for 2-3 players.

Name: Dragões: Guardiões da Memória
Description:
Dragões: Guardiões da Memória is a memory game designed for three children from 6+.

One of the children will be the the guardian, rolling the 4 custom dice showing the 4 parts of a dragon (head, torso, legs and tail) behind a shield. After that, the guardian raise the shield allowing the other two to see the dice results (the color of each dragon part) for a time between 5 and 15s (depending on the age of the players).

When the shield is placed again in position, hiding the dice, the players (not the guardian) must create the result of the dice using tiles representing the dragon parts in the correct colors.
If one child correctly assemble the dragon, he or she receive one dragon egg. The first player to obtain 3 dragon eggs become the new guardian and the game starts again.

There are variants for older children also, including one where the players must start the assemble according to a coin result, from head or from tail. There is also variants for 1 and 2 players.

Name: For the Homeworld
Description:
For the Homeworld is designed around the simple concepts of “Full Thrust” and “Babylon 5: A Call to Arms” that got people back into playing Starship Combat games. We also need enough depth to make the games play out like your favorite Science Fiction Shows. We had a lot of success from 2004-2010 between the Babylon 5, Noble Armada and Starfleet license that Mongoose Publishing had. So like me, you might have a closet full of Starship Miniatures that you would like to interact with each other.

Included in the game are rules and weapons to make it "multi-verse" for your own IP, but also includes ready to go Generic Ships and Lists if you want to play in our Universe. In addition to the Data Cards you can photo copy out of the rulebook, we also have Generic Starship Cards you can download here and on our website. Sized to conveniently be the size of a playing card so you can slip them into a conventional card sleeve with a backing card.

Some of the basics are a basic distance movement value, to keep it simple. But to add some tactical flare, there are both Arcs of fire on weapons - as well as - Arcs where the Hull value on a ship differs (the sides or the rear usually).

As a gamer I have really enjoyed the break from reality that Starship Combat games offer. Working on the "Wolf 359 Combat Simulator" for Last Unicorn Games in the early 2000's, and later with Mongoose in their playtesting and development of the (3) "A Call to Arms" games. It is my hope that through modern production technology, I can bring these rules to life and you can join me in enjoying this sort of Non Electronic Tabletop Wargame.

This will be our 3rd self-published release, and I hope you will join us in playing it.

—description from the designer

Name: Red Traitor: 401k
Description:
Thank you for showing interest in our second game release. These “veteran game mechanics” have been adapted to a “universal” rule set to play a variety of time periods. This book is a stand alone product that does not require any other purchases from us to use your own miniatures collection. Everything you need is right there to play without days of making up your own stuff.

These mechanics been a fun and quick way to play Science Fiction and Modern games with our friends since 2005. We even adapted it to work well in a Victorian “Colonial” setting with a few tweeks. These rules ARE NOT an exact replica of the weapons and equipment of any Era, nor a Hollywood enhancement, but rather to provide a reasonable simulation for enjoyable gameplay.

Quickly about the mechanics... Each figure has a certain number of “actions” each round – in addition they can also react during the enemy’s play. This produces a less static game, but also one that is not so fluid people are never sure where things stand.

This book contains all the Rules you need to play on 4 page large font handy flow chart. As well as a comprehensive Weapons Chart from Spears to Fusion Cannons. In addition are Generic Unit cards you can copy out - or download from our website or facebook - to slip into a standard playing card sleeve for east reference. Not to mention sample Army Lists, Scenarios, and so forth to keep you busy for a little while.

Our goal is to provide you enough material to actually play with, so you do not have to make things up on your own. Our website will contain other fan made products to official support for the game. IE: More scenarios and unit cards.

Thanks to modern publishing techniques, we will be finishing up the following OPTIONAL "Setting Books". Each will include our own world "fluff", specific Unit Cards tailored to the era, Scenarios, and even some old school Terrain tips and Miniature suggestions:


     Our "Victorian Era" setting book will cover my favorite Era of play. From 1870 thru the 1930's across those various Historical periods up through World War 1. Even a dash of information if you prefer to play Victorian Science Fiction. It will contain some of my unpublished materials from the "Battlefield: Evolution" book that would have covered this topic. 
     Our "Science Fiction" setting book will cover man to man, and man to alien, combat in the near and far future. Scenarios and ideas to cover our own Universe, as well as suggestions for your own. 
     Our "World War 2 to Modern" setting book will cover from World War 2 up till the 1990's. It will handle both the Historical needs of those games, as well as, the ability to play "Pulp" action around your favorite stories and comics with lots of blue and red lasers. Including a cross over of our Solo play and Co-Op play material from "Zombie-a-go-go" before the Tidalwave of Zombie games. 
     Our "Cthulhu Mythos" setting book will go hand in hand with the "Xothic Wars" products that I co-designed. Each chapter will cover each one of the races covered with Unit Cards, Scenarios, and suggested miniature ranges. 
     Our "Ancients and Fantasy" setting book will cover things like my favorite Roman historical period, to any range of Fantasy settings and variants. 
     Our "Black Powder" setting book will cover Samurai, Pirates, and from the Seven Years War up through the American Civil War. It will feature my campaign for the 1860-1962 skirmishes in the American Southwest. 


—description from the publisher

Name: NFT: The Card Game
Description:
NFT: The Card Game is a satirical push-your-luck game for 2-5 players.

Outbid the other players to purchase NFTs. Be the first to collect 11 or more joy to win. Avoid sending 3 species of the same rarity score extinct.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rund um die Erde
Description:
The players start at space 1 in Hamburg. The first to reach space 80 wins the game. Movement is determined by a spinner in the center of the game board. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

This game was published about 1903.

—user summary

Name: Auteur
Description:
Auteur is a highly thematic Economic-Strategy board game, about managing a movie-production studio, with Worker Placement with different workers elements and a unique Bumping mechanism.

In the game, players are the Film-makers (Auteur) of an inchoate movie Studio that, during the 5 rounds the game lasts, try to make their studio the most successful there is!

To achieve this, players hire Stars (Actors, Directors, Writers) and try to raise their fame. They gather crew, special guests and extras, upgrade their studio facilities, try to fund through sponsors and bank, promo their movies, and do everything they can, in order to produce their Films.
To have their films premiered, they shall get through the five movie-production stages, during which they get evaluated (earn Prestige/Victory points). Meanwhile they try to follow the hype, fulfill their agendas, and generally do whatever they can to be in the Spotlight.

Sometimes they manage to even win awards, but that's a hard thing to do....By the end, the one who managed to get the most out of their studio, is the winner!

—description from the designer

Name: The Shield of Achilles
Description:
The war at Troy has been waging for 10 years now. Achilles, hero of the greeks prepares to avenge his dear friend Patroclus. In order to do so, Achilles' mother, the goddess Thetis ask the help of Hephaestus (you), blacksmith of the gods to create a new shield for him.

During the course of the game, you will craft the famous shield depicting scenes of ancient greek life. Your objective is to score more points by crafting the shield than the points on your discarded dice by the end of the game. These discarded dice values represent the scrap metal that Apollo steals away from you to create arrows for Paris, who is destined to kill Achilles.

—description from the designer

Name: Nase vorn
Description:
In this game, published by Deutsche Bahn and produced by Ravensburger, players travel within Germany by train, car or plane (and have to pay the costs).
Players choose different modes of transportation to reach their destination as quickly as possible. For reaching the destinations, players receive points that they are allowed to drag forward on the time path. The sooner a player arrives at the destination, the more additional time points he wins. If a player runs out of money, he can spend time to earn some more bucks. The game ends after 6 trips. The winner is the player who is ahead on the time path.

—user summary

Name: ¡Ay, Corona!
Description:
In this fun card game you try to survive the corona pandemic together. Or everyone just looks after themselves.

In chaotic game rounds you switch cards back and forth and try to avoid the virus. Collect toilet paper, become a conspiracy theorist and determine national strategies.

The goal of the game is simple: survive! There are two ways the game ends: either there is only one surviving player left or all cards have been drawn at which point the pandemic is over.

In each round you have to first draw a card and then play an action card. If you pickup a virus card, you're infected and can potentially die. Every players has a risk value that increases by picking up negative status cards. From time to time all infected players have to roll their dice to see if they die. The lower your risk value the higher your chance to survive.

—description from the publisher

Name: Villagers: Shifting Seasons Stretch Goal Pack
Description:
This pack consists of 19 cards that can be added to Villagers and/or Villagers: Shifting Seasons.

8 new Cards: Miller and Baker; Hatter; Acquisitor (x2); Spooner; Glover; Naylor
3 new Developments: Aqueduct; Pier; Monastery
2 new Countess Event cards (for base game solo mode): Bring It On! and Gambit
2 new Countess Mode Helper cards: Burglar; Spy
4 new Events: Youths; Quality Goods; Guilds; Heavy Snows

This pack was made available for free to backers of the Villagers: Shifting Seasons Kickstarter, and it will be made available to purchase directly from Sinister Fish while stocks last.

Name: Home Builder
Description:
You and an opponent are engaged in a friendly competition for the title “Greatest Home Builder” in the Tri-Valley area. To win, you’ll have to successfully assemble all the components needed to build the best houses: Lots, Financing, an Architect and Materials. You’ll also need to add some custom features that buyers want, such as a swimming pool or sun deck.

During the game, you’ll compete for the above components and features by playing hands of 3-card poker. However, since this is a friendly competition, the “pots” are not winner-take-all. Instead, the winner of a round will gain two components, while his/her opponent will gain one – and it’s the winner’s decision. Close attention to your needs and your opponent’s needs is required. Your goal is, ideally, to build each house with the same level of components: fair, good, better, best; this is not always easy. Additionally, land in the Tri-Valley is a bit scarce, so you’re limited to five housing starts. Also, card management in the form of “what to play now and what to save for later” is an important factor in winning the game.

This is the second game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards.


     Print & Play cards available in Files section.
     Professionally produced card deck available at thegamecrafter.com SOON.

Name: Monopoly: Go Green
Description:
It's time to go green! In the Monopoly: Go Green Edition board game, players buy, sell, and trade properties, and invest in greening them up. Build wooden greenhouses to collect more rent and invest in solar and wind utilities. In this edition of the Monopoly game, greenhouses and dice are made of FSC certified wood from well-managed forests, and tokens are made with plant-based plastic derived from sugarcane, a renewable raw material. The package, gameboard, game guide, money, cards, storage bag, insert, and money tray are made with 100% recycled paper.

—description from the publisher

Name: Huarikasaya Kalatakaya!: The Battle of Strongest, Bolivia vs Paraguay, 19-25 May 1934
Description:
Huarikasaya Kalatakaya! is a two player print and play, free mini game (140 counters and 11" x 8,5" map) simulating the climactic battle of Strongest during the Chaco War between Bolivia and Paraguay.

The simulation is at battalion level and play is done in an hexagonal grid map with hexes spanning 1 mile from side to side; each turn is one day of battle.

Special features of the battle as limited command and control, intelligence gathering and severe thirst are all included in the rules set.

—description from the designer
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Regista per un giorno: omaggio al cinema 1895-1995
Description:
Playing with the actors, the dialogues, the plots of 10 very famous films in the history of cinema, become a director and create your own "unreleased" film.

—description from the publisher

To win, each player must try to complete the plot of a film consisting of 8 script-cards containing elements from 10 famous films and reach the score of 55 points. The plot of the movie that players will be able to compose will be different at the end of each game.

Name: アブダク‼ (Abduction!!)
Description:
ã‚¢ãƒ–ãƒ€ã‚¯â€¼ ("Abduction!!") is a small box card game in which players are aliens with orders to abduct a creature known as Ushisan ("cow") from the distant planet ChikyÅ« ("Earth"). Abduction can only be done once, though, so make sure you have the right cow!

Players are each dealt a hand of cards and one command card. Players have two options on their turn: play a card in the field or declare "abduction!" and collect cards from the field to get out of the round.

If you play a card in the field, you need to match the colors or numbers of the adjacent cards vertically and horizontally, or match the colors with multicolored cards. If you declare "abduction!", you can select one row vertically and horizontally and collect up to 5 cards from the edge. You can only abduct once, then you are out of the round.

Abducted cards that match the color of the command card will be scored, and leftover cards in hand will be negative points.

Name: Cascadia: Kickstarter Promo Cards
Description:
Mini expansion including 5 Wildlife Scoring Cards and 1 Rule sheet.
This expansion was added to base game for Kickstarter backers.

Name: Cryptodome
Description:
Cryptodome is the most popular game show set in a future where technology has exploded in countless directions. Salvagers find creative ways to use these technologies to build upon their suits to help navigate an underground magma chamber on Planet Varcob. Play as a salvager, each with a unique ability, as you make your way around the Cryptodome.

The object of the game is to be the first to collect three Power Cores that are located around the outside of the board. Players start at the center and use move cards to make their way to one of the outer edges of the board to collect an artifact or power core. Once collected it's kept for the remainder of the game and the player is teleported back to the start. Artifacts give powerful abilities, but do not contribute to winning the game.

Players get to choose two actions for their turn. They can choose any combination of placing a tile, using a move, and/or drawing a card. Placing a tile allows players to change the path to their advantage or to block their opponents. Using a move can only be done if the corresponding paths are connected. Drawing a card can result in a move card or an ability card.

Cryptodome is a free-for-all game for 2-8 players ages 14 and up that can be played in about an hour. Three types of cards allows for a simple risk/reward system that players can strategize with as the game goes on. Games change in dynamic based on the number of players and the strategies that players tend towards. Players tend to collect up to two artifacts near the beginning of the game and then use them to collect three power cores more effectively.

Kickstarter pre-launch page is up! Follow here for all the updates!
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/jacobvarrogames/cryptodome

Name: First Blood in the Crimea: Battle of the Alma
Description: Two player grand-tactical game using the alternating-actions system introduced in Wagram. That system places the emphasis on players’ mastery of overall operations rather than on the minutiae of tactics. In effect, players role-play each side’s supreme commander, making the decisions those two men would make rather than the whole command chain, as is often the case many complex tactical-level games. [adapted from official description]

Name: Ninja Knights
Description:
In the time of war during the Sengoku period in Japan, four clans vie for control of Sakura Village from its brutal leader, Lord Ishihara.

Ninja Knights is a deck-building action-adventure game. Each player plays as a ninja from one of the competing dojos. The ninja use their decks to control all their actions and complete missions toward victory. They scramble through the random village tiles teeming with enemy samurai and guards. By building up and increasing power with items and ability cards, the ninja race to spy, rescue, and assassinate.

Sneaking and Combat is done by building up combos within the player’s hand.

The enemy actions are controlled by a cube-pull system, which keeps players on their toes. The guards and samurai are constantly moving throughout the village. A simple guard may carry the heart of a lion. While a samurai could easily become something even worse!

Purchasing the many different items from the shops and upgrades from the temple and shrine allow each ninja to focus on their own style. Plus, completed mission cards join the player’s deck for a greater bonus and more buying power.

Ninja Knights uses a streamlined A.I. Ninja that fights to complete missions herself. This evil ninja allows solo play or she can add an extra challenger in two or three player games.

Components included:

1 Rulebook

120+ Poker Cards

16 4”x 4" Boards

12 Blue tokens

14 Red tokens

4 White tokens

12 Yellow tokens

2 Eight-sided Dice

1 Compass Die

2 Green markers

2 Orange markers

2 White markers

3 Ninja Meeples

2 Clear Markers

—description from the publisher

Name: Hold the Line: Excalibur, The Battles of King Arthur
Description:
This game takes the myths, legends, and history to tell the tale of Arthur and his battles as they might have been.

Now you get to refight the battles that were or might have been using an updated and deepened Hold the Line system....

The game comes with 3 campaigns of linked scenarios, with 8 total scenarios:

Campaign 1: SCENARIOS 1 - 3 “THE MATTER OF THE NORTH” (Roughly 490 AD)
Campaign 2: SCENARIOS 4 - 6 “PEACE OR NONE” *Roughly 10 years later (Around 500 AD)
Campaign 3:  SCENARIOS 7 - 8 “THE WINTER OF THE KING”

Scenario 1: The River Glein
Scenario 2: Old Trimontium
Scenario 3: Cat Coit Caledon
Scenario 4: A Sleepy Village
Scenario 5: The Outskirts of Londinium
Scenario 6: The Battle of Badon Hill
Scenario 7: Treachery at the Stables
Scenario 8: The Battle of Camlann

Anyone familiar with the HOLD THE LINE system will quickly pick up the changes.

DETERMINE ACTION POINTS (AP):  In each scenario each side in a turn is given a set number of action points (normally 3 to 5), and then roll a die to receive a random number from 1 to 3 of additional action points.

SIDE A PERFORMS ACTIONS:  The currently active player spends up to his total action points performing the following actions with individual units.  Each unit must complete it's action before the next unit begins it's actions:

1 AP - Activate a unit to move up to its movement allowance
1 AP - Move or attack using 2 adjacent Coastal Raider units 
1 AP - Attack an adjacent unit
1 AP - Leaders may rally 1 hit on a unit they are stacked with
2 AP - Cavalry type units may perform a cavalry charge against non-adjacent enemy units
2 AP - Gesith infantry units may move 1 hex and attack enemy units
2 AP - Berserkers may perform a berserker charge
2 AP - Pictish Chieftains may cavalry charge enemy infantry type units only
After Side A spends all of the Action Points he has available, or passes, then Side B Performs Actions.

After Side B spends all of the Action Points he has available, or passes, the Victory is checked.  If neither side has won a victory, and it is not the last turn of the game, then a new turn begins.

Some of the highlighted system changes are:

Greater unit differentiation in hit/combat ability
Special Leader Abilities
Coastal Raiders group movement and combat 
Berserkers
Cavalry Charges
3 Armies - Romano-British/ Saxons/ Picts
Optional Rules for Merlin and Morganna with special magical abilities

Victory is determined by eliminating opposing units and capturing terrain

Name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Captain America & War Machine
Description:
After the super-soldier serum wore off, Steve Rogers was restored to his natural age. Unable to battle any longer, he retired from the role of Captain America. Rogers chose Sam Wilson, one of his closest and most trusted allies, to take up the shield in his place. Wilson had already proved his commitment to protecting justice as the Avenger Falcon and continues to protect the vulnerable as Captain America.

Lieutenant Colonel James “Rhodey” Rhodes is War Machine, an armored Avenger and walking arsenal. As Tony Stark’s personal pilot and closest friend, Rhodes wears the Variable Threat Response Battle Suit, a suit of armor equipped with a variety of armaments including shoulder-mounted cannons, missile launchers, particle beams, repulsors, and more. War Machine combines his many years of experience as a Marine pilot with Tony Stark’s cutting-edge designs as an Avenger and symbol of mechanized might.

—description from the publisher

Name: Բժշկությունն ԱՅԼ ԿԵՐՊ ( Another way Medical)
Description:
Ô²ÕªÕ·Õ¯Õ¸Ö‚Õ©ÕµÕ¸Ö‚Õ¶Õ¶ Ô±Õ…Ô¼ Ô¿ÔµÕÕŠ ("Another way Medical") is a team-based game where players have to guess words.
It is a thematic application of Ô±ÕµÕ¬ Õ¯Õ¥Ö€Õº (Another way) game, designed for those who understand medicine, biology, human anatomy and healthcare.

Gameplay:
One player draws a card, explains to his teammates the 7 words written on the card one at a time, without using identical words nor the translation of that word into other languages. 
Each guessed word is worth 1 point.
Only 1 minute is allowed.

The team with the most points wins.

Name: Artisans of the Taj Mahal
Description:
Recruit craftspeople, construct the iconic mausoleum of the Taj Mahal and maintain the monument’s beautiful gardens. Erect towering domes, intricate minarets and enormous archways to earn the most points and be declared Master Architect!

Players choose how to best use shared dice on their individual print and play boards to construct their buildings. One die is used to determine the location and the other is used to determine a value. The value might need to be the same as the other rolls for that location, or the values might need to be in ascending order, or maybe the values all need to be even numbers. Players can individually manipulate dice values with raindrop powerups, but there are a limited number so they must be used wisely.

Name: Pocket Quiz: Kopfnüsse
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with mental exercises. The backside of each card contains the solutions. Solve the exercises first and get the card. Player with the most cards at the end of the game wins the game.

This edition contains 150 questions, tasks, and puzzles about various topics.

The title translates to "Headbutts".

Name: Pocket Quiz: Verrückte Natur
Description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 questions about the craziest
curiosities and records from nature. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "Crazy Nature".

Name: That's the yellow from the egg
Description: "That's the yellow from the egg" is a card game about common phrases. If you translate German idioms into the English language you don't get the correct English equivalent, but rather a funny English sentence. Then it's not English, it's Denglish ("D" for Deutsch = German). So one by one the players draw a card and have to translate the Denglish sentences into German and then also have to find the correct English phrase. Only if a player can translate the Denglish phrase into German and then correctly into English they can keep the card. The more cards the players collect, the more points they earn. Whoever earns most points wins.

Name: Fernweh: Das Quiz der 100 Sehnsuchtsorte
Description:
This quiz about 100 exciting places in the world is full of fun, vacation mood and wanderlust. Whether alone or with friends, as inspiration for the next travel destination or to relax after a stressful day: With this quiz, a total of 100 spectacular cities, countries and sights can be discovered.

In addition to exciting quiz questions to puzzle over, the cards also contain informative texts to browse through. 15 of the total of 100 cards are designed as vacation postcards with incredible travel stories. It's up to you to decide: Is the story true or have false facts been added to the adventures? The beautiful vacation photos on all the cards make you feel as if you were right there in Iceland, Las Vergas or Bali.

The title of the game translates to "The quiz of 100 places of desire".

Name: Black Party: Dying at the Discotheque
Description:
In "Black Party" the players embody characters who are involved in a spectacular murder case. One of the players is the murderer. But the others also have their dirty secrets or a motive and each of them have an extra task that only they know.
The group decides by guessing and reconstructing the crime who is the murderer and afterwards the players see if the group was on the right track. So it's about getting away with life. Because what good is it to be innocent if the others think you are guilty?

In "Black Party - Dying at the Discotheque" the players are famous pop stars, hip artists, and corrupt politcians partying at a 1980s disco in New York City. They have to try to find out who murdered real estate tycoon by letting the giant disco ball crash down and hit him...

Name: Black Stories: Tödliche Party
Description:
It's party time - and anything can happen: Whether it's a night of drinking in a club, a graduation party, a New Year's Eve party, a bachelor party, a girls' night out, Father's Day or the infamous "Dorffest" - we love to celebrate wildly! And a lot can go wrong in the process: Highly embarrassing mishaps and crazy ideas that might end fatally...

How to play:
The card set contains 50 tricky, pitch-black puzzle cards for teens and adults to solve by asking clever questions. Cracking black stories together with friends is the most fun. One player, the bidder, takes a card from the deck, reads the short story written on the front of the card. On the back of the card, the master finds the answer, which he of course keeps to himself. Now the guessing people have to "ask" themselves the solution to the story. The questions should be formulated in such a way that the master can answer "yes" or "no". A spooky and fun guessing game for small and large groups - can also be played digitally.

Name: Picture Points
Description:
Everyone knows what a guitar looks like. But who can draw it roughly? Don't worry, this game doesn't require anyone to be a master painter. Here it's all about quick sketches and certain details that earn you points.

How to play:
One player draws a card and reads out a term. Each player draws it as detailed as possible within 30 seconds. Then the card is turned to the picture side and a schematic representation of the term becomes visible. The players get points for certain details. The player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Lauschangriff
Description:
Players are asked to solve listening tasks based on any text read aloud. These tasks can be, for example:
Name a word heard in which a given letter occurs at the end of the word or identify the place where a grammatical case occurs. Whoever presses the buzzer first gets to name the answer. Correct answers earn plus points, wrong answers lose points. Whoever has the most points after the text has been read out wins.

—user summary

Name: Davoser-Spiel
Description: A Monopoly-like game with companies settled in Davos, Switzerland. There are some rule deviations, basically: no houses and hotels, start of sale of expensive land only after sale of all inexpensive land. Nevertheless, the game character of Monopoly is preserved.

Name: Das Riesen Bauernhofspiel
Description:
First, the game board is assembled from 35 puzzle pieces. Then each player chooses a plush animal. The player whose turn it is rolls the color die and may move to the next square of the same color. However, with red you have to move backwards and with white you have to sit out. The first player to reach the blue target field wins.

—user summary

Name: Lasst uns wandern
Description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The worst space is the one on which you realize, you've forgotten your cooking pot and are depending on the mercy of the other players.

—user summary

Name: Super Mission Force: Athwart Time
Description:
Super Mission Force: Athwart Time offers exciting new options for the Goalsystem game of fast and fun superhero skirmish battles! This supplement includes rules for solo and cooperative play, a complete mini-campaign, new character creation options, and new powers. Athwart Time also includes over a dozen stat profiles from the SuperFigs line of figures, giving you more great characters ready to hit the table for super action! You will need a copy of Super Mission Force 1st or 2nd edition to make the best use of this supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Concept: Demo Mini Game
Description: A small demo version of the game Concept (2013).

Name: Cake of Doom
Description:
Take over the world... with cakes!

Players compete to rule Earth by offering delicious bribes of cakes to its inhabitants. They must also watch out for any baking disasters from devious opponents. The first player to control enough regions will win.

A casual, light-hearted card game of cakes and aliens, Cake of Doom is perfect for non-gamers, casual groups, families, or as a palate cleanser for games night.

Let the bribery and sabotage begin!

Name: Salto Wortale
Description:
Who can find all the solution words in the puzzle term? The communication game "Salto Wortale" offers 275 puzzles on 50 topics. The players have to fill out certain categories with words that are already contained in the puzzle term. The player who finds the most words the fastest wins. The game promotes language and is suitable for a non-contact, digital game evening.

How to play: 
The players all receive the same sheet of paper. They have to find the words within long puzzle terms. The player who finds the most words gets the most points and wins.

Name: AucA
Description:
Welcome to you little goose! Today is a great day, the Kingdom of Perigordiä is inviting you on a big adventure. It is said that the most heroic goose will be covered with golden feathers. Multiple tasks await you : collecting ingredients from the Kingdom specialities to prepare recipes, opening treasures or fulfilling the village requests.
Set the pace and be sharp on your journey.

Auca is an exploration game. The aim is to collect tiles to earn a maximum of golden feathers (victory points). To this end, find recipes and the necessary ingredients for their making, search for treasures and collect as many ingredients from the Village tile as possible.

—description from the designer

Name: Ludus
Description:
Ludus is roll & write print & play game created to help Ludus Luderia, the first boardgame café from Brazil, that was in financial difficulties due to the covid pandemic. The PNP version of the game revenue was converted to the "Friends of Ludus" campaign, which helped to keep Ludus Luderia open.

In the game, players are organizing Ludus shelves, helping to store all the games in the best possible way. Use strategy and luck to keep the games on the shelves, taking care that none of them are crushed by heavier games.

On each round, players draft dice, which define the category and format of the game that will be drawn on the shelf. The game ends when one of the players completes the fourth space on their shelf. Each game category has a different scoring condition and game diversity and filled spaces also grant victory points.

The game also features a solo mode, in which the player competes for an increasingly higher score.

Name: Dragons of Dunsmuir
Description:
Dragons of Dunsmuir is a competitive two-player card game in which players battle by using three types of dragons -- Fire, Ice, and Water. In rock-paper-scissors format, each dragon has a type that they defeat and a type that they are defeated by.

The game is played in a series of rounds and each round consists of a series of battles. During a battle, players play out a facedown dragon and then the players reveal. The type and number of the dragon will determine the winner of that battle.

What separates this game from simple rock-paper-scissors randomness is the powers of each dragon. Fire dragon powers focus on scoring more points in certain scenarios, Ice dragon powers focus on revealing information and trading cards, and Water dragon powers focus on exchanging cards from hand with those in the draw pile. Throughout the game, you may find your strategies evolving as you learn your opponent's tendencies and patterns, and as they learn yours as well.

The game ends when a player reaches a certain amount of points at the end of a round.

—description from the designer

Name: Farting Frenchies: Kickstarter Exclusive Cards
Description:
A set of six cards only available during the Kickstarter.

1X Professor Stink Brain
1X Frenchie Fizzle
1X Toot-i-chu
1X Fart-a-saurus-Rex
1X The Wet Willy
1X The French Fry Farter

Name: Conspiracy: Abyss Universe – Bonus Cards
Description:
This set contains 5 Location cards to renew your Conspiracy games.

Available as part of Pack E from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign as well as from Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Don't Look Back: Attack of the Greys Expansion
Description:
Strange and beautiful lights have been seen out in the woods and the people of Northwood have been complaining of missing time and waking nightmares. Everyone ignored the warning, and now it’s too late. Now it's the Attack of the Greys! Try to escape abduction and make it to the bunkers in the North Hills before you become the next sample.

—description from the publisher

This expansion adds 3 Alien Visitor Killer miniatures and 2 custom scenarios to the base game.

Name: Chrome Hammer Ascension: Ride or Die
Description:
The first expansion to Chrome Hammer Ascension includes the following new features:

A new Role for your Crew:
The Jockey sends their specialized Mini-Drones ahead of them to take on the Corporate forces.  This includes new Edges for the Jockey, four different types of specialized mini-drones, and a drone-specific cybernetic implant.

New Enemies:
The Corp Jockey remains hidden, and can't be found until the drones that they're sending after your crew can be traced.
The Sensha tank drone is nigh invulnerable, requiring a lucky hit to take down, but bragging rights for the 'Punk that does.
The Corpomancer is a magical unit that uses the spell rules to throw fireballs at the 'Punks.

New Scenarios:
Welcome Wagon has you hacking turrets before the VIP gets home. Surprise!
Distraction is a balance between drawing attention to your Crew and calling down the entire Corp on your heads.  Also, exploding barrels!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Kingdom of Cuteopia
Description:
As a brave explorer in The Kingdom of Cuteopia, your quixotic quest for fun, friendship, and treasure awaits. Yet, it will not come easy, as there are others traveling this region who have similar objectives, and dangerous pitfalls exist around every bend in the trail. Do you have the moxie and gusto to conquer the numerous baddies who stalk these magical lands, and be rewarded for the risk? If so, trek on, daring one. Become the hero you were meant to be.

How To Play
Players take turns drawing a card from the deck, or playing a card onto the discard pile. There are a few types of cards; "Treasures" go into their "backpack," "baddies" are placed face-up in an open area, and "item," "magic," or "friend," cards are placed in hand to be played on a future turn.

If an event card is drawn, the action stated on the card is to be immediately taken (if possible), and the player's turn ends.

If a player plays a card from their hand to the discard, the action stated on the card is to be immediately followed (if possible).

The game concludes when all cards have been drawn from the deck, and all players can make no moves. The player with the most points wins!

Name: Starship Shuffle
Description:
Welcome to Starbase, Texas. Workers are crafting the behemoth known as Starship. You and your friends can now join this historic moment by cooperatively building the largest, most powerful rocket system to ever exist. Only your teammates can see your rocket components -  will you risk an accident in the production yard? Then try to launch and steer clear of a Rapid Unscheduled Disassembly!

The game starts with the Build Phase.  Each player is dealt a starting hand of Rocket Cards facing AWAY from them.  Players take turns playing one unseen card from their hand onto the field, trying to match it with the Starship's blueprints.  Alternatively, a player can choose to give a hint to a teammate since players can see their teammate's hands.  Players must used memory tactics to manage their turn's action with overall team strategy.  Successful plays of Rocket Cards reward players with Development Cards which can be used to increase the rocket's chance of a successful launch.

If the players successfully build the Starship in time, they move to the Launch Phase.  The launch consists of different stages that must be successfully passed.  To pass each launch stage players take turns randomly drawing from a special hand of cards that is determined by the Development Cards acquired during the Build Phase.

The game is won if players successfully launch and land their rockets during the Launch Phase.  The game is lost if the rocket explodes during launch, or if too many construction accidents happen during the Build Phase.

—description from the publisher

Name: Oops My Bad
Description:
The best party game carefully crafted for awful human beings !

Deep down, your friends are kind of horrible...

Find the wittiest, shrewdest, and most twisted answers to unexpected texts, uncalled-for messages, or random notes with the help of your awful friends.

Each round, one player reads an Inbox card, and everyone else answers with their most hilarious Reply.

—description from the publisher

Name: Mixola
Description:
Three snail dice are red, yellow and blue. The back side without color means white. You throw all three snail dice and look for the corresponding mixed color on the table. Now you can move to the next field of this color. If the field is occupied, you displace the player back to the field of his color. If all three snails show white, you stay standing. For all three colors in the roll, you choose a color. You reach the middle with rainbow colors or throwing your own color when it is no longer on the way, and you win if you are the first to do it.

—user summary

Name: Fussball-Kartenspiel
Description:
Players are given cards with " moves" from a soccer game. Whoever's turn it is puts down a matching "move" card to the previously discarded card. The first player to discard his cards wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Earthenwar
Description:
Earthenwar is a two-player combat strategy game.

You have been recruited to control a huge Golem on a battlefield of the Great War. Using your magic Control Grid, you will remotely determine the actions of your Golem from far behind the Front Lines, attempting to destroy the enemy before they can destroy you.

You change and affect your Golem's movement and attack skills by simply placing, upgrading and using dice on your 8-directional Control Grid.

The game ends when you damage 3 squares in any direction on your opponent's Control Grid.

—description from the designer

Name: Beehive Surprise
Description:
The guard bee (electrically charged) guards its 13 honeycombs. The children now quickly but carefully try to steal a honeycomb. Whoever is caught by the guard bee is eliminated. The last child who remains and was able to steal a honeycomb wins.

—user summary

Name: Blackjack-Tar
Description:
Blackjack-Tar is a variant of Blackjack that uses six black dice instead of the usual deck of cards.

On set-up, each player adds five tokens to the pot. Players take turns, starting with the youngest player.

On their turn, a player bets one to three tokens, adding them to the pot, then rolls the dice one by one until they either quit or bust by rolling over 21.

If a player quits, they receive a payout depending on what they rolled. 16 or fewer has no payout. 17 through 21 gives a payout of 1 through 5 times your bet, respectively. A street (rolling one through six) gives you the entire jackpot. There is no dealer to try and match your roll.

The game ends when the pot is empty, and the winner is the player with the most tokens.

Unlike other black jack dice games, this game uses regular six-sided dice, as opposed to ten- or twelve-sided dice or dice that use suits or the letters J/Q/K/A.

—user summary

Name: Instant Drill
Description:
In this game of intelligent questioning and word hunt set in a military camp, players take on different roles of trainees, lieutenants and observers in a timed drill.

With different roles having different objectives, trainees hunt for a the code word, captain answers all monosyllabic questions, lieutenants guide the trainees and Observers hunt for the lieutenants.

Win the game as a trainee by getting the code word, win as an observer by getting a hold of the lieutenant and win as a lieutenant by staying hidden from the observer.

Name: Instant Sync
Description:
Can you tell what your friends are thinking or how they think?
In this fun game of synchronization and fun descriptions, telepathically connect  with friends

On each turn, players choose game mode and try to synchronize in descriptions to score most  points.
Players select two words(one from each card) comprising a modifier and an identifier and write secretly on their sync pads.
Once everyone is done announce and reveal choice of words then score points according to chosen mode.

—description from the designer
